Key Match Events: Pete Alonso hit a three-run homer in the first inning
Andy Pages hit two home runs
David Peterson scored a run with a wild pitch
Francisco Alvarez scored a run with a single in the third inning
Starling Marte hit a double in the third inning
Francisco Lindor scored a run with a single in the third inning
Brandon Nimmo scored a run with a single in the third inning
Alonso hit a solo shot in the fourth inning
Andy Pages hit a three-run homer in the fourth inning
Jeff McNeil hit a sacrifice fly in the sixth inning
Marte hit a single in the eighth inning that scored Alonso
Hernandez popped up on the first pitch he saw for the final out of the game
Pre-Game Insights: The Mets have stared down the brink of elimination exactly twice in the postseason.
Pete Alonso hit a three-run homer to give the Mets a win in the NL Wild Card over the Milwaukee Brewers.
The Mets bats were too hot, finishing with 14 hits on 34 at-bats to force a Game 6 at Chavez Ravine.
Post-Match Reflections: Aaron Judge expressed pride in the team's resilience after the comeback win
The Mets have kept their MLB playoff dreams alive with a vital win over the Dodgers.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Jack Flaherty gave up eight runs in three innings
Not a single Dodgers pitcher managed to strike out any of the Mets' batters
Flaherty was credited with the loss while Mets reliever Ryne Stanek got the win in a lengthy 2.1 inning outing
Dodgers' vaunted pitching staff let them down early in the game
The Mets unleashed their demons in the third inning, shelling Flaherty for five runs on four hits
The game wasn't over for the Dodgers though. Pages, who had never had a multi-home run game in his career before tonight, took a solo shot to left center field in the top of the fourth inning
The Mets added to their lead with McNeil hitting a sacrifice fly to center to score Winker from third base in the bottom of the sixth
Hernandez popped up on the first pitch he saw for the final out of the game
